Pulse oximeter on patient and functioning
Does patient have a known allery?
Does patient have a difficult airway/aspiration risk?
Does patient have a risk of >500ml blood loss (7ml/kg in children)?
Yes, and adequate intravenous access and fluids planned.
Confirm all team members have introduced themselves by name and role.
Surgeon, anaesthesia professional and nurse verbally confirm patient
Surgeon, anaesthesia professional and nurse verbally confirm site
Surgeon, anaesthesia professional and nurse verbally confirm procedure
What are the critical or unexpected steps, operative duration, anticipated blood loss?
Has sterility (including indicator results) been confirmed? Are there equipment issues or any concerns?
Has antibiotic prophylaxis been given within the last 60 minutes?
Confirm the name of the procedure recorded
Confirm that instrument, sponge and needle counts are correct (or not applicable)
Confirm how the specimen is labelled (including patient name)
Confirm whether there are any equipment problems to be addressed
Review the key concerns for recovery and management of this patient
